snippet: The new law will broaden so-called deprivation powers to include those who are not dual citizens.
abstract: Great Britain passes legislation that allows government to strip terrorism suspects of their citizenship even if it renders them stateless, taking the country’s already sweeping powers to revoke nationality a step further; clause is part of new new immigration bill that removes a previous restriction on leaving individuals without citizenship.
lead_paragraph: The new law will broaden so-called deprivation powers to include those who are not dual citizens.

headline.main: Britain Expands Power to Strip Citizenship From Terrorism Suspects
headline.print_headline: Power to Strip Citizenship Is Expanded in Britain
